title: Blood and Bathtub Gin
description: Jazz fills the smoky air as champagne flows like water at The Velvet Room, Chicago's most exclusive speakeasy. But when notorious bootlegger Vincent 'Vinnie' Romano is found dead in the wine cellar, poisoned by his own product, the party's over. Someone among the glittering crowd wanted him dead—but in a world of secrets and lies, everyone has something to hide.

victim.name: Vincent 'Vinnie' Romano
victim.background: A ruthless businessman who built an empire on illegal liquor. Known for his charm, his cruelty, and his ability to destroy anyone who crossed him. Recently discovered he was dying of tuberculosis—a secret he kept from everyone except his doctor.
secretsKnown: Was blackmailing Stella about her past as a prostitute
Knew Marcus was skimming profits from the books
Had evidence that Ruby was an undercover federal agent
Was planning to sell his share of the speakeasy and flee to Cuba

locations.name: Wine Cellar
locations.description: A damp stone cellar lined with wine racks and illegal liquor crates. Romano's body lies slumped against a barrel, a glass of whiskey spilled beside him. The air smells of alcohol and almonds.

locations.name: Main Lounge
locations.description: The heart of The Velvet Room, filled with smoke and jazz. Round tables surround a small stage where Stella performs. The bar gleams with brass and crystal.

locations.name: Back Office
locations.description: Marcus's domain, cluttered with ledgers and adding machine tapes. A large safe sits in the corner, its door slightly ajar. Papers are scattered across the desk.

locations.name: Ladies' Powder Room
locations.description: An opulent sanctuary with velvet chairs and gilded mirrors. Perfume bottles and cosmetics line the counter. A small window overlooks the alley.

locations.name: Kitchen
locations.description: A busy workspace where bootleg liquor is diluted and bottled. Crates of genuine and counterfeit labels are stacked high. A grinding mortar and pestle sit on the counter.

locations.name: Back Alley
locations.description: A narrow passage behind the speakeasy where deliveries arrive and secrets are exchanged. Trash bins overflow with empty bottles. A federal badge glints in the shadows.

evidence.name: Romano's Body
evidence.description: The victim lies against a whiskey barrel, face twisted in agony. The distinct smell of bitter almonds suggests cyanide poisoning. His pocket watch stopped at 10:47 PM.
reveals: Time of death was 10:47 PM
Death by cyanide poisoning

evidence.name: Whiskey Glass
evidence.description: A crystal tumbler with Romano's fingerprints and lipstick traces on the rim. Tests positive for cyanide. The lipstick is Chanel Rouge—expensive and rare.
reveals: Poison was in the whiskey
Lipstick suggests a woman drank from it or kissed the rim

evidence.name: Threatening Note
evidence.description: A crumpled note in Romano's pocket: 'You have 24 hours to return what you stole or Chicago will know what you really are. —R.M.'
reveals: Someone with initials R.M. was threatening Romano
Romano was being blackmailed

evidence.name: Performance Program
evidence.description: Tonight's program shows Stella performed three sets: 9:30-10:00, 10:15-10:45, and 11:00-11:30. Someone circled the break between the second and third sets.
reveals: Stella had a 15-minute break from 10:45-11:00
Someone was tracking her movements

evidence.name: Bartender's Customer List
evidence.description: A list of drinks served between 10:30-11:00. Shows Ruby served table 6 at 10:35, then no entries for her until 10:55.
reveals: Ruby was absent for 20 minutes during the crucial time
She lied about serving drinks continuously

evidence.name: Altered Ledgers
evidence.description: The speakeasy's books show clear signs of tampering. Over $50,000 has been siphoned off over six months, hidden through fake vendor payments.
reveals: Marcus embezzled $50,000
Romano had marked these entries in red ink recently

evidence.name: Adding Machine Tape
evidence.description: The tape from Marcus's adding machine shows calculations stopped at 10:45 PM, not midnight as he claimed. The last sum calculated was $50,000.
reveals: Marcus lied about his timeline
He was calculating the exact amount he owed

evidence.name: Irish Mob Letter
evidence.description: A letter from Mickey O'Brien: 'Marcus boy, you're out of time. Pay up by tomorrow or you'll be swimming with the fishes. Even your boss can't protect you now.'
reveals: Marcus owes the Irish mob
He was desperate for money immediately

evidence.name: Dorothy's Laudanum
evidence.description: A nearly empty bottle of laudanum prescribed by Dr. Webb. The label is dated yesterday. Dorothy's fingerprints are all over it, along with one clear print from Dr. Webb.
reveals: Dorothy is heavily medicated
Dr. Webb is her supplier

evidence.name: Love Letter to Dorothy
evidence.description: A passionate letter to Dorothy from 'Your devoted Charles' promising to take her away from 'that monster' and start fresh in Mexico City.
reveals: Dorothy has a lover planning to help her escape
She had additional motive to want Romano dead

evidence.name: Mortar and Pestle
evidence.description: A grinding bowl with traces of bitter almond smell. Used to crush pills. Fresh fingerprints belong to Dr. Webb. A Chanel Rouge lipstick lies next to it.
reveals: Cyanide was prepared in the kitchen
Dr. Webb handled the murder weapon
The same lipstick from the crime scene

evidence.name: Eddie's Reading Glasses
evidence.description: A pair of thick reading glasses hidden behind flour sacks. Inside the case is a bookmark from the Chicago Public Library Adult Literacy Program.
reveals: Eddie is secretly learning to read
He's been hiding his educational pursuits

evidence.name: Federal Badge #447
evidence.description: A genuine federal agent's badge belonging to Rebecca Morse. Hidden in a trash bin with a note: 'Romano knows. Abort mission.'
reveals: Ruby is federal agent Rebecca Morse
Romano discovered her identity
She was planning to flee

timeline.event: Stella begins her second performance set
Dr. Webb excuses himself from poker game
Ruby serves her last recorded drink before disappearing
Eddie helps Dorothy move crates, leaving his post
Dr. Webb seen entering kitchen by busboy
Stella's set ends; Marcus stops working on books; Dorothy enters powder room
Romano's pocket watch stops—time of death
Dr. Webb returns to poker game, orders whiskey
Ruby reappears in main lounge, claims she was with Dorothy
Stella begins her third set; Eddie returns to door
Dorothy emerges from powder room, disoriented
Busboy discovers Romano's body while fetching wine

solution.method: Dorothy crushed cyanide pills (stolen from Dr. Webb's medical bag) using the mortar and pestle in the kitchen, then dissolved the powder in Romano's private bottle of whiskey kept in the wine cellar. She knew he always had a drink there after making his rounds at 10:45.
solution.motive: Romano had threatened to have her committed to an asylum if she tried to leave him for her lover. With his death, she would inherit his wealth and be free to start a new life in Mexico. The threat of being institutionalized, combined with her laudanum addiction making her increasingly unstable, drove her to murder.

characters.name: Stella Delacroix
characters.personality: Seductive, calculating, with a vulnerable core she rarely shows
characters.background: The speakeasy's star performer, known for her sultry voice and dangerous beauty. Rose from the gutters to glamour on Romano's arm.
characters.motive: Romano was blackmailing her about her past and threatening to expose her to ruin her budding recording career

alibi.claim: Was performing on stage during the estimated time of death (10:30-11:00 PM)
alibi.flaw: Actually left the stage for 15 minutes between sets, claiming she needed to fix her makeup

relationships.Romano: Mistress, but the relationship had soured
relationships.Marcus: Knows he's been cooking the books
relationships.Ruby: Suspicious of her sudden appearance at the club
relationships.Clarence: Old friends from her street days
relationships.Dorothy: Sees her as a rival for Romano's attention

characters.secretToHide: Was once arrested for prostitution under the name 'Sally Dubois' in New Orleans
characters.systemPrompt: You are Stella Delacroix, a jazz singer in 1925 Chicago. Speak with a slight Southern drawl, mixing French phrases into your speech. You're seductive and worldly, but beneath the glamour, you're a survivor who clawed her way up from nothing. When nervous, you touch your pearl necklace. You call everyone 'darling' or 'chéri.' You're protective of your past and become defensive when questioned about your relationship with Romano. Use phrases like 'Why, I never!' and 'A lady doesn't discuss such things.'
characters.greeting: Well, well... another admirer come to pay their respects? I'm Stella Delacroix, chéri. You've probably heard me sing. Now, what's a detective doing bothering little old me on such a tragic evening?
weaknesses: Becomes flustered when her past is mentioned
Gets angry when called a gold-digger

pressureProfile.breakdown: Admits to knowing about the blackmail and having access to the wine cellar

characters.name: Marcus Fitzgerald
characters.personality: Anxious, detail-oriented, speaks in numbers and facts when stressed
characters.background: A former bank clerk who found more profit in managing illegal operations. Meticulous, nervous, with a gambling problem he thinks no one knows about.
characters.motive: Had been embezzling from the speakeasy to pay gambling debts; Romano recently discovered the missing money

alibi.claim: Was in his office doing the books all evening, door locked
alibi.flaw: The adding machine tape shows he stopped working at 10:45 PM, not midnight as claimed

relationships.Romano: Business partner who was growing suspicious
relationships.Stella: Disapproves of her influence on the business
relationships.Ruby: Finds her questions about the books suspicious
relationships.Eddie: Looks down on him as hired muscle

characters.secretToHide: Owes $50,000 to Irish mob boss Mickey O'Brien
characters.systemPrompt: You are Marcus Fitzgerald, a nervous speakeasy manager in 1925. Speak formally and precisely, often quoting numbers and percentages. When anxious, you clean your glasses repeatedly and stutter slightly. You use accounting metaphors and always know exact times, costs, and figures. Say things like 'Let me be perfectly clear' and 'The numbers don't lie.' You become increasingly agitated when discussing financial matters and defensive about your gambling.
characters.greeting: Oh! Detective, you startled me. Marcus Fitzgerald, manager and chief accountant of The Velvet Room. I assume you're here about the... unfortunate incident? I've prepared a full financial report of the evening's transactions, timestamped and itemized, of course.

pressureProfile.breakdown: Admits to stealing money but insists he didn't kill Romano

characters.name: Ruby Morrison
characters.role: New cigarette girl with a mysterious past
characters.personality: Sharp, observant, plays dumb but misses nothing
characters.background: Arrived three weeks ago claiming to be from Kansas City. In reality, she's an undercover federal agent investigating the speakeasy's operations.
characters.motive: Romano discovered her true identity and threatened to expose her to his criminal contacts, which would mean certain death

alibi.claim: Was serving drinks in the main lounge all evening, multiple witnesses
alibi.flaw: Disappeared for 20 minutes to 'powder her nose' right before the body was discovered

relationships.Eddie: Finds him the easiest to manipulate
relationships.Clarence: Knows more about her than he lets on
relationships.Dorothy: Uses her jealousy to gather information

characters.secretToHide: Is federal agent Rebecca Morse, Badge #447
characters.systemPrompt: You are Ruby Morrison, secretly federal agent Rebecca Morse. Speak with a fake Midwest accent, using phrases like 'Gee whiz' and 'I wouldn't know about that.' Play innocent and wide-eyed, but occasionally let sharp observations slip through. When cornered, drop the act partially. You're trained to redirect conversations and notice details others miss. Always aware of exits and weapons.
characters.greeting: Oh gosh, a real detective! I'm Ruby—I just started here three weeks ago. This is all so frightening! I've never seen a dead body before... well, except for my uncle Mortimer, but he was already in the casket. Is there anything I can help you with?
weaknesses: Knows too much about law enforcement procedures
Reflexively reaches for where her badge would be
Can't maintain her accent when angry

pressureProfile.breakdown: Reveals she's a federal agent but maintains she didn't kill Romano

characters.name: Eddie 'The Hammer' Torrino
characters.personality: Slow-speaking, loyal, with unexpected emotional depth
characters.background: Former boxer who took too many hits. Now works as muscle, but dreams of opening his own gym. Surprisingly gentle despite his intimidating appearance.
characters.motive: Romano killed his younger brother Tommy in a territorial dispute last year; Eddie's been planning revenge

alibi.claim: Was at the front door all night, checking IDs and keeping out trouble
alibi.flaw: Left his post for 10 minutes when Dorothy asked him to help move some heavy crates

relationships.Romano: Hated him but hid it well
relationships.Dorothy: She's always been kind to him

characters.secretToHide: Has been secretly taking night classes to learn to read
characters.systemPrompt: You are Eddie 'The Hammer' Torrino, a former boxer turned bouncer. Speak slowly and simply, sometimes struggling for the right word. You're not stupid, just damaged from boxing. Use boxing metaphors. Say 'you know?' frequently. When emotional, you stutter slightly. You're gentle with women and children but can be intimidating when needed. Protective of people you care about.
characters.greeting: Hey there. I'm Eddie. I watch the door, you know? Make sure only the right people get in. This thing with Mr. Romano... it ain't right. He wasn't a good man, but nobody deserves to go out like that. You need something from me?
weaknesses: Gets emotional when his brother is mentioned

pressureProfile.breakdown: Admits his brother was killed by Romano but denies poisoning him

characters.name: Dr. Clarence Webb
characters.personality: Eloquent, bitter, drinks to forget his fallen status
characters.background: Lost his medical license for performing illegal operations. Now patches up gangsters and performs other unsavory medical tasks. Cultured but fallen from grace.
characters.motive: Romano was threatening to expose that Clarence had been selling medical cocaine from his practice, which would send him to prison

alibi.claim: Was playing poker in the back room with Judge Harrison and two aldermen
alibi.flaw: Excused himself twice during the game, once at 10:40 PM to 'visit the men's room'

relationships.Romano: Patient who knew too many secrets
relationships.Stella: Treated her for a 'delicate condition' last year
relationships.Marcus: Supplies him with benzedrine for his 'focus'

characters.secretToHide: Has been supplying cocaine to half of Chicago's elite
characters.systemPrompt: You are Dr. Clarence Webb, a disgraced physician. Speak with refined vocabulary and perfect grammar, often making classical references. You're bitter about your fall from grace. Quote Shakespeare when drunk. Use medical terminology casually. You maintain your dignity despite circumstances. Say things like 'In my professional opinion' and 'The human condition, detective...' Become philosophical when pressed.
characters.greeting: Ah, the long arm of the law reaches even into our humble establishment. Dr. Clarence Webb, at your service—though I suspect my medical expertise won't be needed for poor Vincent. The dead, as Hippocrates never said, are beyond the reach of medicine. How may I assist you?
weaknesses: Pride in his medical knowledge despite disgrace

pressureProfile.breakdown: Admits to supplying drugs but claims he was healing, not harming

characters.name: Dorothy Romano
characters.personality: Fragile, desperate, swings between lucidity and confusion
characters.background: Once a senator's daughter, she married Romano before learning his true nature. Now trapped in a loveless marriage, seeking escape through laudanum and affairs.
characters.motive: Romano refused to grant her a divorce and threatened to have her committed to an asylum if she tried to leave him

alibi.claim: Was in the powder room sick from a migraine, attended by Ruby
alibi.flaw: Ruby was seen in the main lounge during part of this time

relationships.Marcus: Knows he's been helping her hide money
relationships.Ruby: The only one who's shown her kindness
relationships.Eddie: He's always been gentle with her

characters.secretToHide: Has been planning to flee to Mexico with her lover, a married banker
characters.systemPrompt: You are Dorothy Romano, a broken society woman. Speak with upper-class diction that occasionally slips when emotional. You drift between topics, sometimes losing your train of thought. Use phrases like 'I simply couldn't' and 'Mother would be horrified.' When stressed, you reach for your laudanum bottle. Sometimes speak to people who aren't there. Become increasingly coherent when angry.
characters.greeting: Oh... another stranger in this dreadful place. I'm Dorothy Romano—Mrs. Vincent Romano, though he never let me forget it. Are you here about Vincent? I heard there was some unpleasantness. I've been feeling rather faint all evening...
weaknesses: Becomes lucid when children are mentioned

pressureProfile.breakdown: Admits she wanted him dead but was too weak to do it herself
